meanings.definition: Cause (someone) to do something through reasoning or argument.
meanings.sent1: She persuades her friend to try the new ice cream flavor.
meanings.sent2: The salesman persuades the customer to buy the latest model.
meanings.sent3: The cat persuades the dog to share the sunny spot by the window.
meanings.sent4: The music persuades the audience to dance with joy.
meanings.sent5: His smile persuades even the grumpiest person to smile back.

meanings.definition: Win over (someone) to a particular belief, action, or way of thinking.
meanings.sent1: He persuades his classmates to join the environmental club.
meanings.sent2: The politician persuades the voters with promises of positive change.
meanings.sent3: The clown persuades the grumpy old man to laugh at his silly jokes.
meanings.sent4: The beauty of nature persuades us to appreciate the world around us.
meanings.sent5: Her determination persuades everyone to support her cause.
